問：英文your company和our company近年常見譯做「貴司」、「我司」而不是「貴公司」、「本公司」，這是中文商業書信正確用語嗎？
答：「司」有「主管其事」的意思。官府職有專司，往往就稱為「有司」，例如諸葛亮《出師表》勸後主劉禪：「若有作姦犯科，及為忠善者，宜付有司論其刑賞。」官府自稱則是「本司」，例如唐朝長慶三年，禮部侍郎王起掌科舉考試，上奏說：「請今年進士堪及第者，本司考試訖，其詩賦先送中書門下詳覆。」中文公函會謙稱自己的公司為「敝公司」，而尊稱對方的公司為「貴公司」。至於讀者說的「貴司」、「我司」，則是中共的現代漢語，文化氣息全無，下流品味十足，但用於公函，大概也無妨，反正今天香港人說的寫的，十九是這種官方語言了。

問：英文your company和our company近年常見譯做「貴司」、「我司」而不是「貴公司」、「本公司」，這是中文商業書信正確用語嗎？
答：「司」有「主管其事」的意思。官府職有專司，往往就稱為「有司」，例如諸葛亮《出師表》勸後主劉禪：「若有作姦犯科，及為忠善者，宜付有司論其刑賞。」官府自稱則是「本司」，例如唐朝長慶三年，禮部侍郎王起掌科舉考試，上奏說：「請今年進士堪及第者，本司考試訖，其詩賦先送中書門下詳覆。」中文公函會謙稱自己的公司為「敝公司」，而尊稱對方的公司為「貴公司」。至於讀者說的「貴司」、「我司」，則是中共的現代漢語，文化氣息全無，下流品味十足，但用於公函，大概也無妨，反正今天香港人說的寫的，十九是這種官方語言了。

quote.msg: silent can not amount to acceptance

replies.msg:
When Silence is Acceptance

To every rule, there is an exception. Silence can be understood as acceptance when both parties had a preexisting relationship before the current contract.

For example, suppose you own a restaurant that makes an acclaimed dish out of pork belly. You form a good relationship with your local pork belly supplier, agree on a delivery schedule and a price, and this continues for years. One year, your supplier's herd unfortunately sickens, and the price of pork belly goes up. Your supplier sends you a letter reflecting the new price, and you do not respond in any way. At this point, you should probably expect that your shipments of pork belly would continue as usual, as your silence could be understood to indicate that you wanted to continue the business arrangement.

In a broader sense, silence can signal acceptance of terms in relationships where silence has been interpreted as such in the past. In addition, actions in the affirmative (such as carrying out one's terms of the offer) also can be construed as acceptance, regardless of whether anything was communicated verbally.

quote.msg: silent can not amount to acceptance

When Silence is Acceptance

To every rule, there is an exception. Silence can be understood as acceptance when both parties had a preexisting relationship before the current contract.

For example, suppose you own a restaurant that makes an acclaimed dish out of pork belly. You form a good relationship with your local pork belly supplier, agree on a delivery schedule and a price, and this continues for years. One year, your supplier's herd unfortunately sickens, and the price of pork belly goes up. Your supplier sends you a letter reflecting the new price, and you do not respond in any way. At this point, you should probably expect that your shipments of pork belly would continue as usual, as your silence could be understood to indicate that you wanted to continue the business arrangement.

In a broader sense, silence can signal acceptance of terms in relationships where silence has been interpreted as such in the past. In addition, actions in the affirmative (such as carrying out one's terms of the offer) also can be construed as acceptance, regardless of whether anything was communicated verbally.

When Silence is Acceptance

To every rule, there is an exception. Silence can be understood as acceptance when both parties had a preexisting relationship before the current contract.

For example, suppose you own a restaurant that makes an acclaimed dish out of pork belly. You form a good relationship with your local pork belly supplier, agree on a delivery schedule and a price, and this continues for years. One year, your supplier's herd unfortunately sickens, and the price of pork belly goes up. Your supplier sends you a letter reflecting the new price, and you do not respond in any way. At this point, you should probably expect that your shipments of pork belly would continue as usual, as your silence could be understood to indicate that you wanted to continue the business arrangement.

In a broader sense, silence can signal acceptance of terms in relationships where silence has been interpreted as such in the past. In addition, actions in the affirmative (such as carrying out one's terms of the offer) also can be construed as acceptance, regardless of whether anything was communicated verbally.

quote.msg:
我讀過contract law
thanks for sharing

When Silence is Acceptance

To every rule, there is an exception. Silence can be understood as acceptance when both parties had a preexisting relationship before the current contract.

For example, suppose you own a restaurant that makes an acclaimed dish out of pork belly. You form a good relationship with your local pork belly supplier, agree on a delivery schedule and a price, and this continues for years. One year, your supplier's herd unfortunately sickens, and the price of pork belly goes up. Your supplier sends you a letter reflecting the new price, and you do not respond in any way. At this point, you should probably expect that your shipments of pork belly would continue as usual, as your silence could be understood to indicate that you wanted to continue the business arrangement.

In a broader sense, silence can signal acceptance of terms in relationships where silence has been interpreted as such in the past. In addition, actions in the affirmative (such as carrying out one's terms of the offer) also can be construed as acceptance, regardless of whether anything was communicated verbally.

https://smallbusiness.findlaw.com/business-contracts-forms/can-silence-signal-acceptance.html#

quote.msg: 重點係一份合約要legally binding 要有consideration (promissory estoppel另計）而就算creditor講明accept翠華既offer to vary the amount of debt 個creditor都可以之後照樣要求翠華俾原價 因爲Foakes v Beer 講明 undertaking to perform pre-existing legal obligation (payment of debt in this case) 唔可以係valid consideration 所以翠華同creditor之間8折找數既agreement(if any)都唔會enforceable

但係如果翠華以8折找數作為條件
同供應商訂立新合約 承諾往後n個月內都會問供應商拎貨
咁又有冇效？
要睇下「問供應商拎貨」尼個promise 係pre-existing obligation 定係新既promise 如果係前者既agreement to pay less一樣唔會legally binding

replies.msg:
咁如果呢點唔係pre-existing obligation
而係新的承諾呢？
供應商收左嗰8成之後
可唔可以以「驚唔接受就收唔到數」為理由
要求法庭裁決新合約無效同埋追埋嗰兩成貨款？

因為而家翠華就咁單方面要8折找數就必定無效
供應商可以錢照收 之後再告佢
但假如翠華用新合約做擋箭牌 而且翠華亦都冇明言唔接受新合約就唔找數
供應商就面對一個難題
情況一：
接受新合約 但會冇左2成貨款
情況二：
唔接受新合約 但收唔到數

法官會唔會認為呢種情況訂立的新合約涉及非法脅迫 所以合約無效
定係會認為接受左新合約就應該履行
唔接受去法庭就應該告佢
唔可以接受左之後再反口？

quote.msg: silent can not amount to acceptance

When Silence is Acceptance

To every rule, there is an exception. Silence can be understood as acceptance when both parties had a preexisting relationship before the current contract.

For example, suppose you own a restaurant that makes an acclaimed dish out of pork belly. You form a good relationship with your local pork belly supplier, agree on a delivery schedule and a price, and this continues for years. One year, your supplier's herd unfortunately sickens, and the price of pork belly goes up. Your supplier sends you a letter reflecting the new price, and you do not respond in any way. At this point, you should probably expect that your shipments of pork belly would continue as usual, as your silence could be understood to indicate that you wanted to continue the business arrangement.

In a broader sense, silence can signal acceptance of terms in relationships where silence has been interpreted as such in the past. In addition, actions in the affirmative (such as carrying out one's terms of the offer) also can be construed as acceptance, regardless of whether anything was communicated verbally.

【設立危機處理委員會評估疫情 翠華全體高層減薪三成】

翠華控股發公告，指一直密切關注疫症，並謹慎以對。公司董事宣布，已設立危機處理委員會，以評估疫症對集團運營及財務表現的影響，並採取必要預防應變措施。

該委員會由兩名非執行董事及一名獨立非執行董事組成。該委員會負責提供戰略方向及制定預防措施，以在各方面盡量降低疫症風險，建立應對程序以減輕對集團顧客及員工的醫療保健及安全的負面影響，並協調集團高級管理層及各部門以實施任何應對疫症的措施。

由於目前新型冠狀病毒疫情仍然持續，集團正密切審視市場情況，透過該委員會適時調整策略應對，並全體董事局及高級管理層成員亦率先由2020年2月1日起減薪30%，為期3個月，作為調節成本方案的第一步。

【設立危機處理委員會評估疫情 翠華全體高層減薪三成】

翠華控股發公告，指一直密切關注疫症，並謹慎以對。公司董事宣布，已設立危機處理委員會，以評估疫症對集團運營及財務表現的影響，並採取必要預防應變措施。

該委員會由兩名非執行董事及一名獨立非執行董事組成。該委員會負責提供戰略方向及制定預防措施，以在各方面盡量降低疫症風險，建立應對程序以減輕對集團顧客及員工的醫療保健及安全的負面影響，並協調集團高級管理層及各部門以實施任何應對疫症的措施。

由於目前新型冠狀病毒疫情仍然持續，集團正密切審視市場情況，透過該委員會適時調整策略應對，並全體董事局及高級管理層成員亦率先由2020年2月1日起減薪30%，為期3個月，作為調節成本方案的第一步。

quote.msg: silent can not amount to acceptance

When Silence is Acceptance

To every rule, there is an exception. Silence can be understood as acceptance when both parties had a preexisting relationship before the current contract.

For example, suppose you own a restaurant that makes an acclaimed dish out of pork belly. You form a good relationship with your local pork belly supplier, agree on a delivery schedule and a price, and this continues for years. One year, your supplier's herd unfortunately sickens, and the price of pork belly goes up. Your supplier sends you a letter reflecting the new price, and you do not respond in any way. At this point, you should probably expect that your shipments of pork belly would continue as usual, as your silence could be understood to indicate that you wanted to continue the business arrangement.

In a broader sense, silence can signal acceptance of terms in relationships where silence has been interpreted as such in the past. In addition, actions in the affirmative (such as carrying out one's terms of the offer) also can be construed as acceptance, regardless of whether anything was communicated verbally.
